Building RAG Pipelines with LangChain and Neo4j

Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) has become the standard approach for building LLM applications that need access to custom knowledge bases.

In this tutorial, we'll explore how to combine LangChain's document processing capabilities with Neo4j's graph database to create a powerful RAG pipeline.

Prerequisites

  • Python 3.11+
  • LangChain 0.2
  • Neo4j 5 Community Edition
  • An OpenAI API key

Setting Up the Graph

First, we need to set up our Neo4j instance and create the vector index for storing embeddings.

from langchain_neo4j import Neo4jVector

The key insight is that graph relationships provide additional context that pure vector similarity misses.
